verses.verse: Then Eliphaz<WH464> the Temanite<WH8489> answered,<WH6030>
"Can a man<WH1397> be profitable<WH5532> to God?<WH410> Surely<WH3588> he who is wise<WH7919> is profitable to himself.<WH5532>
Is it any pleasure<WH2656> to the Almighty,<WH7706> that you are righteous?<WH6663> Or does it benefit<WH1215> him,<WH1870> that you make your ways perfect?<WH8552>
Is it for your piety<WH3374> that he reproves<WH3198> you,<WH935> that he enters with you into judgment?<WH4941>
Isn't<WH7451> your wickedness great?<WH7227> Neither is there any end<WH7093> to your iniquities.<WH5771>
For you have taken pledges<WH2254> from your brother<WH251> for nothing,<WH2600> and stripped<WH6584> the naked<WH6174> of their clothing.<WH899>
You haven't<WH4325> given water to the weary<WH5889> to drink,<WH8248> and you have withheld<WH4513> bread<WH3899> from the hungry.<WH7457>
But as for the mighty<WH2220> man,<WH376> he had the earth.<WH776> The honorable man,<WH5375> he lived in it.<WH3427>
You have sent<WH7971> widows<WH490> away empty,<WH7387> and the arms<WH2220> of the fatherless<WH3490> have been broken.<WH1792>
Therefore snares<WH6341> are around<WH5439> you.<WH6597> Sudden fear<WH6343> troubles you,<WH926>
or darkness,<WH2822> so that you can not see,<WH7200> and floods<WH8229> of waters<WH4325> cover you.<WH3680>
"Isn't<WH433> God in the heights<WH1363> of heaven?<WH8064> See<WH7200> the height<WH1363> of the stars,<WH3556> how high they are!<WH7311>
You say,<WH559> <WH410> 'What does God know?<WH3045> Can he judge<WH8199> through the thick darkness?<WH6205>
Thick clouds<WH5645> are a covering<WH5643> to him,<WH7200> so that he doesn't see. He walks<WH1980> on the vault<WH2329> of the sky.<WH8064>'
Will you keep<WH8104> the old<WH5769> way,<WH734> which wicked<WH205> men<WH4962> have trodden,<WH1869>
who were snatched away<WH7059> before their time,<WH6256> whose foundation<WH3247> was poured<WH3332> out as a stream,<WH5104>
who said<WH559> to God,<WH410> <WH5493> 'Depart from us;<WH7706>' and, 'What can the Almighty do for us?<WH6466>'
Yet he filled<WH4390> their houses<WH1004> with good<WH2896> things,<WH6098> but the counsel of the wicked<WH7563> is far from me.<WH7368>
The righteous<WH6662> see<WH7200> it,<WH8055> and are glad. The innocent<WH5355> ridicule them,<WH3932>
saying,<WH518> 'Surely those who rose up against<WH7009> us are cut off.<WH3582> The fire<WH784> has consumed<WH398> their remnant.<WH3499>'
"Acquaint<WH5532> yourself with him,<WH7999> now, and be at peace. Thereby good<WH2896> shall come to you.<WH935>
Please receive<WH3947> instruction<WH8451> from his mouth,<WH6310> and lay up<WH7760> his words<WH561> in your heart.<WH3824>
If you return<WH7725> to the Almighty,<WH7706> you shall be built up,<WH1129> if you put away<WH7368> unrighteousness<WH5766> far<WH7368> from your tents.<WH168>
Lay<WH7896> your treasure<WH1220> in<WH5921> the dust,<WH6083> the gold of Ophir<WH211> among the stones<WH6697> of the brooks.<WH5158>
The Almighty<WH7706> will be your treasure,<WH1220> and precious<WH8443> silver to you.<WH3701>
For then you will delight<WH6026> yourself in the Almighty,<WH7706> and shall lift up<WH5375> your face<WH6440> to God.<WH433>
You shall make your prayer<WH6279> to him,<WH8085> and he will hear you.<WH7999> You shall pay your vows.<WH5088>
You shall also decree<WH1504> a thing,<WH562> and it shall be established<WH6965> to you.<WH216> Light shall shine<WH5050> on your ways.<WH1870>
When they cast down,<WH8213> you shall say,<WH559> <WH1466> 'be lifted up.' He will save<WH3467> the humble<WH7807> person.<WH5869>
He will even deliver<WH4422> him<WH336> who is not innocent.<WH5355> Yes,<WH4422> he shall be delivered through the cleanness<WH1252> of your hands.<WH3709>"
